verses.verse: Moreover the LORD<WH3068> answered<WH6030> <WH853> Job,<WH347> and said,<WH559>
Shall he that contendeth<WH7378> with<WH5973> the Almighty<WH7706> instruct<WH3250> him? he that reproveth<WH3198> God,<WH433> let him answer<WH6030> it.
Then Job<WH347> answered<WH6030> <WH853> the LORD,<WH3068> and said,<WH559>
Behold, <WH2005> I am vile;<WH7043> what<WH4100> shall I answer<WH7725> thee? I will lay<WH7760> mine hand<WH3027> upon<WH3926> my mouth.<WH6310>
Once <WH259> have I spoken;<WH1696> but I will not<WH3808> answer:<WH6030> yea, twice;<WH8147> but I will proceed no further.<WH3254> <WH3808>
Then answered<WH6030> the LORD<WH3068> unto<WH853> Job<WH347> out of<WH4480> the whirlwind,<WH5591> and said,<WH559>
Gird up<WH247> thy loins<WH2504> now<WH4994> like a man:<WH1397> I will demand<WH7592> of thee, and declare<WH3045> thou unto me.
Wilt thou also<WH637> disannul<WH6565> my judgment?<WH4941> wilt thou condemn<WH7561> me, that<WH4616> thou mayest be righteous?<WH6663>
Hast thou an arm<WH2220> like God?<WH410> or canst thou thunder<WH7481> with a voice<WH6963> like him?<WH3644>
Deck <WH5710> thyself now<WH4994> with majesty<WH1347> and excellency;<WH1363> and array<WH3847> thyself with glory<WH1935> and beauty.<WH1926>
Cast abroad<WH6327> the rage<WH5678> of thy wrath:<WH639> and behold<WH7200> every one<WH3605> that is proud,<WH1343> and abase<WH8213> him.
Look on<WH7200> every one<WH3605> that is proud,<WH1343> and bring him low;<WH3665> and tread down<WH1915> the wicked<WH7563> in their place.<WH8478>
Hide <WH2934> them in the dust<WH6083> together;<WH3162> and bind<WH2280> their faces<WH6440> in secret.<WH2934>
Then will I<WH589> also<WH1571> confess<WH3034> unto thee that<WH3588> thine own right hand<WH3225> can save<WH3467> thee.
Behold <WH2009> now<WH4994> behemoth,<WH930> which<WH834> I made<WH6213> with<WH5973> thee; he eateth<WH398> grass<WH2682> as an ox.<WH1241>
Lo <WH2009> now,<WH4994> his strength<WH3581> is in his loins,<WH4975> and his force<WH202> is in the navel<WH8306> of his belly.<WH990>
He moveth<WH2654> his tail<WH2180> like<WH3644> a cedar:<WH730> the sinews<WH1517> of his stones<WH6344> are wrapped together.<WH8276>
His bones<WH6106> are as strong pieces<WH650> of brass;<WH5154> his bones<WH1634> are like bars<WH4300> of iron.<WH1270>
He <WH1931> is the chief<WH7225> of the ways<WH1870> of God:<WH410> he that made<WH6213> him can make his sword<WH2719> to approach<WH5066> unto him.
Surely <WH3588> the mountains<WH2022> bring him forth<WH5375> food,<WH944> where<WH8033> all<WH3605> the beasts<WH2416> of the field<WH7704> play.<WH7832>
He lieth<WH7901> under<WH8478> the shady trees,<WH6628> in the covert<WH5643> of the reed,<WH7070> and fens.<WH1207>
The shady trees<WH6628> cover<WH5526> him with their shadow;<WH6752> the willows<WH6155> of the brook<WH5158> compass him about.<WH5437>
Behold, <WH2005> he drinketh up<WH6231> a river,<WH5104> and hasteth<WH2648> not:<WH3808> he trusteth<WH982> that<WH3588> he can draw up<WH1518> Jordan<WH3383> into<WH413> his mouth.<WH6310>
He taketh<WH3947> it with his eyes:<WH5869> his nose<WH639> pierceth<WH5344> through snares.<WH4170>
